name: src/jira.js

unknown.tagValue:
Wrapper for the JIRA Rest Api
https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/6.4.8/

properties.name: protocol
properties.description:
What protocol to use to connect to
jira? Ex: http|https

properties.name: host
properties.description:
What host is this tool connecting to for the jira
instance? Ex: jira.somehost.com

properties.name: port
properties.description:
What port is this tool connecting to jira with? Only needed for
none standard ports. Ex: 8080, 3000, etc

properties.name: username
properties.description:
Specify a username for this tool to authenticate all
requests with.

properties.name: password
properties.description:
Specify a password for this tool to authenticate all
requests with.

properties.name: apiVersion
properties.description:
What version of the jira rest api is the instance the
tool is connecting to?

properties.name: base
properties.description:
What other url parts exist, if any, before the rest/api/
section?

properties.name: strictSSL
properties.description:
Does this tool require each request to be
authenticated?  Defaults to true.

properties.name: request
properties.description:
What method does this tool use to make its requests?
Defaults to request from request-promise

properties.name: timeout
properties.description:
Integer containing the number of milliseconds to wait for a
server to send response headers (and start the response body) before aborting the request. Note
that if the underlying TCP connection cannot be established, the OS-wide TCP connection timeout
will overrule the timeout option ([the default in Linux can be anywhere from 20-120 *
seconds](http://www.sekuda.com/overriding_the_default_linux_kernel_20_second_tcp_socket_connect_timeout)).

properties.name: webhookVersion
properties.description:
What webhook version does this api wrapper need to
hit?

properties.name: greenhopperVersion
properties.description:
What webhook version does this api wrapper need
to hit?

Specify an oauth object for this tool to authenticate all requests using
OAuth.

properties.name: consumer_key
properties.description: The consumer entered in Jira Preferences.

properties.name: consumer_secret
properties.description: The private RSA file.

properties.name: access_token
properties.description: The generated access token.

properties.name: access_token_secret
properties.description: The generated access toke secret.

properties.name: signature_method
properties.description:
[signature_method=RSA-SHA1] - OAuth signurate methode
Possible values RSA-SHA1, HMAC-SHA1, PLAINTEXT. Jira Cloud supports only RSA-SHA1.

unknown.tagValue: Creates a requestOptions object based on the default template for one

params.name: options
params.description: an object containing fields and formatting how the

properties.name: method
properties.description: HTTP Request Method. ie GET, POST, PUT, DELETE

unknown.tagValue: Creates a URI object for a given pathname

params.name: pathname
params.description: The url after the /rest/api/version

unknown.tagValue: Creates a URI object for a given pathName

params.name: pathname
params.description: The url after the /rest/

unknown.tagValue: Creates a URI object for a given pathName

params.name: pathname
params.description: The url after the /rest/

unknown.tagValue: Does a request based on the requestOptions object

params.name: requestOptions
params.description:
fields on this object get posted as a request header for
requests to jira

params.name: issueNumber
params.description: The issue number to search for including the project key

params.name: expand
params.description: The resource expansion to return additional fields in the response

params.name: version
params.description:
the version of your product you want to find the unresolved
issues of.

unknown.tagValue:
Get the Project by project key
[Jira Doc](http://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/latest/#id289232)

params.name: project
params.description: key for the project

params.name: project
params.description: with specs

name: findRapidView
description: Find the Rapid View for a specified project

params.name: projectName
params.description: name for the project

name: getLastSprintForRapidView
description: Get the most recent sprint for a given rapidViewId

params.name: rapidViewId
params.description: the id for the rapid view

name: getSprintIssues
description: Get the issues for a rapidView / sprint

params.name: rapidViewId
params.description: the id for the rapid view

params.name: sprintId
params.description: the id for the sprint

name: listSprints
description: Get a list of Sprints belonging to a Rapid View

params.name: rapidViewId
params.description: the id for the rapid view

name: addIssueToSprint
description: Add an issue to the project's current sprint

params.name: issueId
params.description: the id of the existing issue

params.name: sprintId
params.description: the id of the sprint to add it to

name: issueLink
description: Create an issue link between two issues

params.name: link
params.description: a link object formatted how the Jira API specifies

name: getRemoteLinks
description: Retrieves the remote links associated with the given issue.

params.name: issueNumber
params.description: the issue number to find remote links for.

unknown.tagValue: Creates a remote link associated with the given issue.

params.name: issueNumber
params.description: The issue number to create the remotelink under

params.name: remoteLink
params.description: the remotelink object as specified by the Jira API

params.name: project
params.description: A project key to get versions for

params.name: version
params.description: an object of the new version

params.name: version
params.description: an new object of the version to update

params.name: versionId
params.description: the ID of the version to delete

params.name: moveFixIssuesToId
params.description:
when provided, existing fixVersions will be moved
                to this ID. Otherwise, the deleted version will be removed from all
                issue fixVersions.

params.name: moveAffectedIssuesToId
params.description:
when provided, existing affectedVersions will
                be moved to this ID. Otherwise, the deleted version will be removed
                from all issue affectedVersions.

name: searchJira
description:
Pass a search query to Jira
[Jira Doc](https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/latest/#d2e4424)

params.name: searchString
params.description: jira query string in JQL

params.name: optional
params.description: object containing any of the following properties

params.name: optional.startAt
params.description: optional starting index number

params.name: optional.maxResults
params.description: optional ending index number

params.name: optional.fields]:
params.description: optional array of string names of desired fields

params.name: user
params.description: Properly Formatted User object

properties.name: username
properties.description: A query string used to search username, name or e-mail address

properties.name: startAt
properties.description: The index of the first user to return (0-based)

properties.name: maxResults
properties.description: The maximum number of users to return

properties.name: includeActive
properties.description:
If true, then active users are included
in the results

properties.name: includeInactive
properties.description:
If true, then inactive users
are included in the results

name: getUsersInGroup
description: Get all users in group on Jira

params.name: groupname
params.description: A query string used to search users in group

params.name: startAt
params.description: The index of the first user to return (0-based)

params.name: maxResults
params.description: The maximum number of users to return (defaults to 50).

name: getUsersIssues
description:
Get issues related to a user
[Jira Doc](http://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/latest/#id296043)

params.name: username
params.description: username of user to search for

params.name: open
params.description: determines if only open issues should be returned

params.name: issue
params.description: Properly Formatted Issue object

name: addWatcher
description: Add a user as a watcher on an issue

params.name: issueKey
params.description: the key of the existing issue

params.name: username
params.description: the jira username to add as a watcher to the issue

params.name: issueId
params.description: the Id of the issue to delete

params.name: issueId
params.description: the Id of the issue to delete

params.name: issueUpdate
params.description: update Object as specified by the rest api

params.name: project
params.description: key for the project

params.name: component
params.description: Properly Formatted Component

params.name: componentId
params.description: the Id of the component to delete

name: listFields
description:
List all fields custom and not that jira knows about.
[Jira Doc](http://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/latest/#id290489)

name: listPriorities
description:
List all priorities jira knows about
[Jira Doc](http://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/latest/#id290489)

name: listTransitions
description:
List Transitions for a specific issue that are available to the current user
[Jira Doc](http://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/latest/#id290489)

params.name: issueId
params.description: get transitions available for the issue

params.name: issueId
params.description: the Id of the issue to delete

params.name: issueTransition
params.description: transition object from the jira rest API

name: addComment
description:
Add a comment to an issue
[Jira Doc](https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/latest/#id108798)

params.name: issueId
params.description: Issue to add a comment to

params.name: comment
params.description: string containing comment

name: addWorklog
description:
Add a worklog to a project
[Jira Doc](http://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/latest/#id291617)

params.name: issueId
params.description: Issue to add a worklog to

params.name: worklog
params.description: worklog object from the rest API

params.name: newEstimate
params.description: the new value for the remaining estimate field

params.name: issueId
params.description: the Id of the issue to delete

params.name: worklogId
params.description: the Id of the worklog in issue to delete

name: listIssueTypes
description:
List all Issue Types jira knows about
[Jira Doc](http://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/latest/#id295946)

params.name: webhook
params.description: properly formatted webhook

name: getWebhook
description:
Get a webhook by its ID
[Jira Doc](https://developer.atlassian.com/display/JIRADEV/JIRA+Webhooks+Overview)

params.name: webhookID
params.description: id of webhook to get

params.name: webhookID
params.description: id of the webhook to delete

name: getBacklogForRapidView
description: Retrieve the backlog of a certain Rapid View

params.name: rapidViewId
params.description: rapid view id

params.name: issueId
params.description: issue id

params.name: readStream
params.description: readStream object from fs
